meanings.definition: To draw out or extend beyond a certain point.
meanings.sent1: She outdrawn the line on the paper until it reached the edge.
meanings.sent2: The magician outdrawn the scarf from his sleeve effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The student outdrawn the time for the test by asking too many questions.
meanings.sent4: Her determination outdrawn the limits of her physical endurance.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes outdrawn the boundaries of the canvas.

meanings.definition: To surpass in drawing or pulling out.
meanings.sent1: He outdrawn all his competitors in the archery contest.
meanings.sent2: The horse outdrawn the carriage with its speed.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outdrawn the others in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: Her charisma outdrawn any doubts the audience had.
meanings.sent5: The river outdrawn its banks after heavy rainfall.

meanings.definition: To exhaust or deplete by drawing out.
meanings.sent1: The long meeting outdrawn all our energy by the end.
meanings.sent2: The constant demands of the job outdrawn his enthusiasm.
meanings.sent3: The comedian outdrawn the audience's laughter with his jokes.
meanings.sent4: The marathon outdrawn her stamina, but she finished strong.
meanings.sent5: The drought outdrawn the water sources in the region.
